speed_limits.notes: Varies by province. Trans-Canada Highway can be 90-110 km/h.

alcohol_limit.notes: 0.05% warns/suspension in many provinces (e.g., BC, Ontario). 0.08% is criminal offense.

rules.priority_rules: Right of way to vehicles already in roundabout.

tolls.notes: Few toll roads (e.g., 407 ETR in Ontario is electronic only).

rules.parking_rules: Winter parking bans common for snow removal.
rules.winter_rules: Winter tires mandatory in Quebec (Dec 1 - Mar 15) and recommended elsewhere.

summary: Driving in Canada is similar to the US, but with metric units (km/h). Winter driving conditions can be severe. Right turn on red allowed unless posted (except Island of Montreal).
common_traps: Right turn on red is prohibited on the entire Island of Montreal.
School bus flashing lights: traffic both ways must stop.
Move Over Law: slow down/move over for emergency vehicles.
rental_and_idp_notes: Most licenses accepted for short visits. IDP recommended if not in English/French.
